item.title: Japan Dodges Bond Market Dangers With Successful 30-Year Sale
item.description: Investors lapped up 30-year Japanese government bonds in an auction on Thursday that indicates policymakers are having some success in quelling debt-market volatility.
item.dc:creator: Aya Wagatsuma

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians cross an intersection in the Shibuya district of Tokyo, Japan. Photographer: Shiho Fukada/Bloomberg

item.title: Japan Investment Corporation's Hata on VC Industry
item.description: Yuka Hata, Senior Managing Director & Head of Fund Investments at Japan Investment Corporation, discusses Japan's VC industry and investment trends in 2025. She joins from the sidelines of startup conference, IVS, in Kyoto, and speaks with David Ingles and Yvonne Man on "Bloomberg: the China Show." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Oil Declines With Trade Deal Progress, OPEC+ Decision in Focus
item.description: Oil fell after its biggest gain in almost two weeks, with traders monitoring trade talks between the US and its partners and this weekend’s OPEC+ meeting.
item.dc:creator: Yongchang Chin

item.title: Indonesia Grants Brazil, Turkey Visa-Free Entry in Tourism Push
item.description: Indonesia has extended visa-free entry to citizens of Brazil and Turkey, a rare privilege in the Southeast Asian nation aimed at boosting tourism and business ties.
item.dc:creator: Chandra Asmara

media:content.media:description: Visitors at Double Six beach in Seminyak, Bali. Nyimas Laula/Bloomberg

item.title: Starmer Crisis Shows UK Still Lives at Mercy of Bond Market
item.description: Global bond investors reminded Prime Minister Keir Starmer of a harsh truth of British politics: The market’s verdict can be swift and punishing.
item.dc:creator: Joe Mayes, Greg Ritchie, Freya Jones

media:content.media:description: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves and Prime Minister Keir Starmer Photographer: Jacob King/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Asian Equities in Tight Range Ahead of US Payrolls: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian shares fluctuated ahead of a US jobs report, with investors awaiting fresh data after recent prints signaled President Donald Trump’s trade war was hurting the US economy.
item.dc:creator: Anand Krishnamoorthy

item.title: MUFG Innovation Partners' Sano on Investment Strategies
item.description:
Takashi Sano, CIO of MUFG Innovation Partners, venture capital arm of MUFG, discusses investment strategies to scale up Japanese and regional startups, and shares his views on the challenges that remain. He joins from the sidelines of startup conference, IVS, in Kyoto, and speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud Watts on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade".
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Headline Asia's Tanaka on Investing in Startups
item.description:
Akio Tanaka, Co-founder and Partner of Headline Asia, discusses his investment strategies and philosophy for building up Japanese startups, and says a more global mindset is needed if they want to scale up and attract global investors. He joins from the sidelines of startup conference, IVS, in Kyoto, and speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud Watts on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade".
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tata Is Said to Be in Talks to Buy Out Investors in Resurgent
item.description: Tata Group is in talks to buy out other shareholders in Resurgent Power Ventures Pte, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Trump says Trade Deal Reached with Vietnam | Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 7/3/25
item.description: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Malaysia Rate Cut Bets Grow as Tariff Talks Weigh on Outlook
item.description: Expectations are growing for Malaysia’s central bank to cut interest rates at its policy meeting on July 9, which is also the deadline for countries to reach trade deals with the US to avert swingeing tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Anisah Shukry

media:content.media:description: The Malaysian flag at the Port of Tanjung Pelepas, in Iskandar Puteri, Johor, Malaysia.

item.title: India’s E-Commerce Stocks Outrun Chinese Peers on Profit Hopes
item.description: India’s top e-commerce stocks have outpaced local indexes and regional peers over the past month, as a rapid rebound fuels bets on their ability to edge out rivals and boost profitability.

item.title: Shrinking Profit Margins Unwind Popular ‘Make in India’ Trade in Electronics
item.description: A sector that underpinned the once-popular “Make in India” trade is faltering as shrinking margins and slowing growth shake investor confidence.
item.dc:creator: Alex Gabriel Simon

item.description: AustralianSuper is increasing its allocation to unlisted assets as the country’s biggest pension fund works to finalize four private equity deals by the end of the year, according to the firm’s investment chief.

item.title: US Lifts Rules for Ethane Exports to China, Producers Say
item.description: US ethane producers said the government has removed license requirements for shipping the gas to China, clearing the way for deliveries to the country’s ports without additional approvals.

item.title: More Fixed Income Value Outside of US, JPMorgan Asset Management's Sheng Says
item.description:
JPMorgan Asset Management's Sylvia Sheng shares her views on fixed income opportunities. Sheng says there's "more value outside of the US, especially looking at Europe." She also says the firm favors Hong Kong and Japanese equities. Sheng speaks on Bloomberg Television.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bond Traders Eye High-Stakes US Jobs Report for Fed Rate Clues
item.description: Investors in the US Treasury market are zeroing in on a pivotal jobs report Thursday as they weigh the chances of the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates as soon as this month.
item.dc:creator: Ye Xie, Michael Mackenzie

media:content.media:description: Commuters board a train at the 14th Street-Union Square subway station in New York. Photographer: Adam Gray/Bloomberg

item.title: Gold’s Record Rally Ignites Fundraising Spree for China Miners
item.description: A wave of Chinese gold miners is pushing to raise funds in Hong Kong, seeking to capitalize on rising investor interest in the metal during a record-setting rally that’s made it a standout commodity performer.
item.dc:creator: Yihui Xie, Julia Fioretti

item.title: Japan’s Bond Market Faces First 30-Year Sale Since Issuance Cut
item.description: Japan’s auction of 30-year sovereign notes Thursday is shaping up as a barometer of policymakers’ success in quelling debt-market turmoil that pushed yields on the nation’s super-long bonds to record highs in May.
item.dc:creator: Aya Wagatsuma

item.title: India Warming to Larger Private Credit Deals, Cerberus Says
item.description: The market is warming to large private credit deals in India, where local borrowers are typically less levered than their peers in the rest of Asia, according to Indranil Ghosh, managing director and head of pan-Asia special situations at Cerberus Capital Management.
item.dc:creator: Saikat Das

item.title: Beijing Braces for US Trade Deals That Aim to Shut Out China
item.description: The trade truce between Washington and Beijing may be holding for now, but China is increasingly wary about what’s happening elsewhere: US efforts to forge deals that could isolate Chinese firms from global supply chains.
item.dc:creator: James Mayger

media:content.media:description: Gantry cranes and container ships at the Yangshan Deepwater Port in Shanghai.

item.title: What We Know As US, Vietnam Said To Reach Trade Deal
item.description: President Donald Trump said he had reached a trade deal with Vietnam following weeks of intense diplomacy between the nations and ahead of a deadline next week that would have seen higher tariffs imposed on the country’s imports. Bloomberg's Derek Wallbank breaks down what we know so far. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Asia Hedge Funds Win Bigger Allocations at Manager Bought by BNP
item.description: Axa IM Prime, part of the global asset manager recently acquired by BNP Paribas SA, has been boosting its allocation to Asia hedge fund managers in the past five years, when the retreat of US institutions left the regional industry starved of fresh cash.
item.dc:creator: Bei Hu

item.title: Gold Eases After Three-Day Rally Ahead of Fed-Watched Jobs Data
item.description: Gold eased after a three-day gain, before pivotal US jobs data due later Thursday that may shape the outlook for the Federal Reserve’s monetary easing path.
item.dc:creator: Sybilla Gross

item.title: Milei Is Tapping Argentina’s Permian in a Bid to Cement His Reforms
item.description: Oil exports are ramping up from the Vaca Muerta shale deposit in Patagonia after years of false starts. It’s a boom the libertarian president is counting on.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Gilbert

media:content.media:description: Argentina is emerging as home of the world’s next shale boom.

item.title: Indonesian Firms Set to Extend Bond Issuance Surge on Low Rates
item.description: Indonesian companies look set to charge ahead with bond issuance in the last six months of the year, building on a record-breaking first half as they face a wave of maturing debt and favorable borrowing costs.
item.dc:creator: Harry Suhartono

item.title: Emerging Asian Bonds Look Poised to Lure Back Overseas Funds
item.description: Asian bond markets may start to attract overseas investors once again thanks to resilient local currencies and the prospect of interest-rate cuts from regional central banks.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Wong

item.title: Dip Buyers Set to Pounce as Tariff Deadline Nears, Markets Pulse Survey Shows
item.description: Even if the run-up to this month’s deadline for US trade deals weighs on stocks, bargain hunters will step in to stem losses, the latest Markets Pulse survey showed.
